temples.summary: Surrounded by beautiful mountains and fields of wheat, the Payson temple was dedicated in 2015. It was the fifteenth temple built in Utah and the third temple in Utah County. There is an apple blossom theme throughout the temple. It is one of the largest temples.

temples.summary: The Jordan River Temple was the seventh temple to be built in Utah and the twentieth temple in the world, at the time of its dedication in 1981. Tear drops are a theme found on its fences and spire. It is also one of the few temple where the angel Moroni is holding the gold plates.

temples.summary: The Gilbert Temple is a magnificent addition to Arizona's greater Pheonix area. When the temple was dedicated 2014, it was the tallest building in Gilbert. The Gilbert temple was the 142nd temple to be built worldwide.

temples.summary: Standing out from all over Utah Valley and located just west of the majestic Mount Timpanogos, the Mount Timpanogos temple was dedicated in 1996. It was the 49th temple dedicated in the world and the 9th temple in Utah.
